text: @YHClimateCom @PCANcities @YorkshireWater @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @andy_gouldson @UniversityLeeds @Northpowergrid @NGNgas @YorkshireUnis @The_TUC ü•±

@SpacePootler @polkapolkaW13 @acabbie @MarcusxGrant @mariamartak @steve_ren @Photo_Iain @jenstridonkai @darrenmoore @WorldBollard @SchJustina11 @ellielockx @P_DriscollW5W13 @MetCC @EnvAgency @XREaling @RBourchier @standardnews @ediz1975 It's a terrible junction and the tailbacks are made worse by the narrow lane. This can't be changed because of the plane trees. If a bus stops, it holds one lane up. But this was an issue before LTNs. You do have more traffic trying to turn left from Uxbridge to N.A. though.

text: @polkapolkaW13 @acabbie @MarcusxGrant @mariamartak @steve_ren @Photo_Iain @jenstridonkai @darrenmoore @WorldBollard @SpacePootler @SchJustina11 @ellielockx @P_DriscollW5W13 @MetCC @EnvAgency @XREaling @RBourchier @standardnews @ediz1975 Exactly. The tailbacks on Northfield Avenue tend to be caused by a combination of the pinch-points for on-street parking, buses stopping (at stops or these pinch-points), traffic lights and zebra crossings. The road works have been the cause of the large queues by the allotments.
